page.title: 06Burley School
page.content: Burley school was built in 1855.The school only had one long room. Miss Warren was head mistress.The children used to pay one penny but it was raised to two old pennies.Children did not have school dinners until 1939 In 1841 the ground was formally taken over by the Vicar and Church wardens. The school was built on two acres of land granted by the forest,and placed as a church of England school,under a mixed committee of church men and nonconformists.Today the school consists of a main building with four classrooms and entrance hall,outside toilets, storage sheds, dining room and cycle shed.There is a school wood land area.The school has 3 classrooms and one hall.The next school you go to is Twynham or Ringwood comprehensive schools.Sixth form college is Brockenhurst.David Ive Richard Sherred
